IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CANNON SCHOOL WAS FOUNDED IN 1968 AND IS A NON-PROFIT, INDEPENDENT SCHOOL THAT FOCUSES ON THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT. THE SCHOOL OCCUPIES A 65-ACRE CAMPUS JUST OFF THE I-85 CORRIDOR IN CONCORD, NC. APPROXIMATELY 1058 STUDENTS WERE ENROLLED AT THE SCHOOL DURING THE FISCAL YEAR IN GRADES JUNIOR KINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12TH GRADE. CANNON ENCOURAGES STUDENTS TO STRETCH TO THEIR FULLEST POTENTIAL AND BECOME ENGAGED STUDENTS AND OUTSTANDING CITIZENS. CANNON'S LOWER SCHOOL STRESSES ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, WITH A BALANCE OF ENRICHMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND AN EMPHASIS ON CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT. CANNON'S MIDDLE SCHOOL PROVIDES A CLIMATE FOR EMERGING YOUNG ADULTS TO NURTURE THEIR LOVE OF LEARNING, STRENGTHEN THEIR SELF CONCEPT, AND EXPLORE EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. CANNON'S UPPER SCHOOL DEDICATES ITSELF TO DEVELOPING TEACHING PRACTICES AND CURRICULUM THAT EQUIP STUDENTS TO LEARN HOW TO LEARN AND IS BASED ON TRADITIONAL COLLEGE PREPARATORY CURRICULUM.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVISION OF QUALITY K12 EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM WITHIN A SAFE, DIVERSE AND CHALLENGING ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION - PRIMARY AND SECONDARY EDUCATION WHICH BENEFITS STUDENTS WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, RELIGION, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN. THE SCHOOL SERVED APPROXIMATELY 1058 STUDENTS DURING THE 2022-2023 SCHOOL YEAR. SPECIAL PROGRAMS INCLUDE AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS AND SUMMER CAMP. AUXILIARY SERVICES INCLUDE BUS TRANSPORTATION FOR STUDENTS AND A SCHOOL STORE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST SWAP 35,496. COST OF GOOD SOLD 68,463.
ADJUSTMENT TO PLEDGES RECEIVABLE VALUE 414,631. FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS 3,778,150. ROUNDING 11.
FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS 3,778,150. ADJUSTMENT TO PLEDGES RECEIVABLE VALUE 414,631. ROUNDING 1.

ENDOWMMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO FUND A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS THAT ARE ALIGNED WITH THE SCHOOL'S EXEMPT PURPOSE. THOSE FUNDS WITH DONOR IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS ARE EXPENDED ACCORDING TO THE DONOR RESTRICTIONS. THERE ARE SPENDING POLICIES BASED UPON INVESTMENT RETURNS.
CANNON SCHOOL'S RACIALLY NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY APPEARS ON ITS ONLINE HOMEPAGE, WWW.CANNONSCHOOL.ORG, IN ACCORDANCE WITH REVENUE PROCEDURE 2019-22.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS PROVIDED WITH A PUBLIC DISCLOSURE COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO REVIEW. A FULL COPY OF THE FORM 990 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING, AND WILL BE KEPT AT THE SCHOOL BUSINESS OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW AND SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S ASSISTANT COLLECTS ALL SIGNED CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES FROM TRUSTEES AND REVIEWS FOR ANY POTENTIAL ISSUES. THESE ARE COLLECTED FROM ALL NEW TRUSTEES AS THEY CHANGE DURING THE YEAR. DURING THE COURSE OF THE YEAR, ANY TRUSTEE WITH A POTENTIAL CONFLICT RECUSES HIMSELF/HERSELF FROM DISCUSSIONS AND/OR VOTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE (COMPOSED OF INDEPENDENT TRUSTEES) FOR ITS HEAD OF SCHOOL THAT UNDERTOOK INITIAL STUDIES OF COMPARABILITY SOURCE DATA FROM THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS ("NAIS") TO DETERMINE THE HEAD'S OVERALL COMPENSATION. THE COMPENSATION DETERMINATION PROCESS IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MEETING MINUTES. ADDITIONALLY, THE COMPENSATION IS REEXAMINED ON A PERIODIC BASIS TO ENSURE REASONABLENESS. THE SCHOOL HAS A FULLTIME HUMAN RESOURCE DIRECTOR ("HRD") THAT ASSISTS IN PULLING TOGETHER COMPENSATION MARKET DATA FOR ALL OTHER POSITIONS. ANNUALLY, BENCHMARKING DATA IS PROVIDED BY THE HRD TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR THE LEADERSHIP TEAM. BENCHMARKING DATA IS PULLED FROM DASL, A DATABASE PROVIDED BY THE NAIS. COMPARATOR SCHOOLS INCLUDE THOSE IN THE LOCAL/STATE AREA AND THE SOUTHEAST REGION; ALL SCHOOLS ARE DAY SCHOOLS THAT ARE SIMILAR IN SIZE/SCOPE. GENERALLY, THE STANDARD RAISE PERCENTAGE FOR ALL EMPLOYEES, APPROVED BY THE BOARD, IS GIVEN TO EACH LEADER. SOMETIMES, IF A LEADER IS BELOW THE COMPETITIVE MEDIAN RATE AS COMPARED TO OTHERS WITH SIMILAR YEARS OF SERVICE, AN ADDITIONAL INCREASE ABOVE THE BOARD APPROVED RATE IS GIVEN. THIS IS DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE PROCESS USED TO DETERMINE THE SALARY FOR THE DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS AND FINANCE IS THE SAME AS LISTED ABOVE. HOWEVER, BOARD APPROVAL IS REQUIRED EACH YEAR. SIGNED DOCUMENTATION BY THE BOARD CHAIR IS PROVIDED TO THE HRD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF INTEREST SWAP 35,496. ROUNDING -10.
